metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5374 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The CRC32C feature in the Btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel before 3.8-rc1 allows local users to cause a denial of service (extended runtime of kernel code) by creating many different files whose names are associated with the same CRC32C hash value. A denial of service flaw was discovered in the Btrfs file system in the Linux kernel. A local user could cause a denial of service by creating a large number of files with names that have the same CRC32 hash value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-5374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> Per kernel team, patch is too intrusive to backport

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').

linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-signed package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
